info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 12:20PM CDT until June 14 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Pottawatomie. In east central Oklahoma, Seminole. In southeast Oklahoma, Hughes.
* WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shawnee, Seminole, Tecumseh, Wetumka, Maud, Earlsboro, Tribbey, St. Louis, Brooksville, Macomb and Harjo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Hughes, OK; Pottawatomie, OK; Seminole, OK
